Title: Corporate Event Predictions Using Large Language Models
Abstract: this paper offers a thorough assessment of large language models  llms  in the context of corporate event prediction. to achieve this we formally establish the task of corporate event prediction construct a novel dataset containing summaries of earning call transcripts and conduct comprehensive experiments involving both raw and fine tuned variants of the primary llms. our experimental findings underscore the viability of automating this intricate task using llms and highlight the unnecessariness of additional finetuning.
